edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream
Class Bitstream

java.lang.Object
  edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream.Bitstream

public class Bitstream
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a Xilinx bitstream. It contains a BitstreamHeader object and a PacketList object that contains all of the bitstream packets.

Field Summary
protected  DummySyncData _dummySyncData
          Dummy words, optional bus width auto detection pattern (0x000000BB 0x11220044), and sync word
protected  BitstreamHeader _header
          Bitstream files can have a header that provides useful information about the bitstream and device.
protected  PacketList _packets
          The packets in the bitstream

Field Detail

_header

protected BitstreamHeader _header
Bitstream files can have a header that provides useful information about the bitstream and device. This header is not required and thus this class member may be null.

_dummySyncData

protected DummySyncData _dummySyncData
Dummy words, optional bus width auto detection pattern (0x000000BB 0x11220044), and sync word

_packets

protected PacketList _packets
The packets in the bitstream

getHeader

public BitstreamHeader getHeader()
Get the bitstream's header.

getDummySyncData

public DummySyncData getDummySyncData()

getPackets

public PacketList getPackets()
Get the bitstream's packet list.

getRawBytesNoHeader

public java.util.List<java.lang.Byte> getRawBytesNoHeader()
Get the raw bytes in the bitstream, not including the header. This method is safe to call whether or not the bitstream has a header.

getDataLength

public int getDataLength()
Get the data length of the bitstream. This includes the bytes in the dummy/sync data and all of the packets in the packet list.

getRawBytes

public java.util.List<java.lang.Byte> getRawBytes()
Get the raw bytes in the bistream. This method is safe to call whether or not the bitstream actually has a header. It includes the header only if the bitstream has one.

getRawBytesWithHeader

public java.util.List<java.lang.Byte> getRawBytesWithHeader()
Get the raw bytes in the bitstream, including the header. This method is only safe to call if the bitstream actually has a header (use hasHeader() to determine whether the bitstream has a header).

hasHeader

public boolean hasHeader()
Determine whether the bitstream has a header.

                           throws java.io.IOException
Write the bitstream, including the header, to the given OutputStream. This method is only safe to call if the bitstream has a header.

outputBitstream

public void outputBitstream(java.io.OutputStream ostream)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Write the bitstream. If the header exists, write the bitstream with the header. If the header does not exist, write the bitstream wihtout the header.

writeBitstreamToMCS

public void writeBitstreamToMCS(java.io.OutputStream os)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Generate an MCS (PROM) file. This method generates an .mcs file that should match the output of the Xilinx promgen tool when used with '-u 0'. The format is closely related to the INtel MCS86 (Inellec 86) file format specification. It is an ASCII representation of the bitstream packets. This format does not include the bitstream header. This is an older method copied from Ben Sellers/Chris Lavin's old tools and has not yet been tested in the new bitstream tools.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

addDummyAndSyncWords

protected java.util.List<java.lang.Byte> addDummyAndSyncWords(java.util.List<java.lang.Byte> bytes)
Add the dummy/sync word data to the given list of bytes and return the result.
